fi.tuni.tamk.tiko.tiko2a

Class Prefs

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.tuni.tamk.tiko.tiko2a.Prefs

  • public class Prefs
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles our saved data. Uses the Preferences.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Prefs()
      Here we load stuff at the start, stuff like the volume, which language is in use, how many playthroughs/obstacles/backgrounds the player has seen.

        Here we load stuff at the start, stuff like the volume, which language is in use, how many playthroughs/obstacles/backgrounds the player has seen.

    • Method Detail

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(float volume)
        This method is used to save the volume when player moves the slider in Settings.
        Parameters:
        volume - Volume as float

      • setFin

        public void setFin(boolean isFin)
        This method is used to save which language is in use
        Parameters:
        isFin - The boolean that changes which language is in use

      • getFin

        public boolean getFin()
        Returns which language to use.
        Returns:
        The language boolean

      • setMusicValue

        public void setMusicValue(boolean m)
        This method is used to save which music is in use (was last played). This is to help check what music to play next time.
        Parameters:
        m - boolean value that affects which music is going to be played

      • getMusicValue

        public boolean getMusicValue()
        This method returns the current boolean value for the music.
        Returns:
        music boolean

      • setAmountofCompletions

        public void setAmountofCompletions()
        This method is used to save the amount of completions the player has done. This is called when the player finishes a playthrough

      • getVolume

        public float getVolume()
        This method is used to get the volume to use.
        Returns:
        Volume as float

      • getAmountofCompletions

        public int getAmountofCompletions()
        This method is used to get the amount of completions.
        Returns:
        Amount of completions

      • setAndCheckEste

        public void setAndCheckEste(int index)
        This method is used to check whether the player is seen the obstacle or not. If it hasn't, change the boolean to true to indicate that the player has seen it.
        Parameters:
        index - Which obstacle we are checking

      • setAndCheckBack

        public void setAndCheckBack(int index)
        This method is used to check whether the player is seen the Background or not. If it hasn't, change the boolean to true to indicate that the player has seen it.
        Parameters:
        index - Which Background we are checking

      • getAmountOfBoolean

        public void getAmountOfBoolean(java.lang.String whatToCalc)
        We save the information of the seen backgrounds and obstacles as booleans in following way (Obstacle1 = false/true) etc. This method is used to turn the seen booleans into a boolean array, since you can't store arrays in preferences file, we need to store them one by one and then turn them into a array in code.
        Parameters:
        whatToCalc - This method can be used to calculate both Obstacles and Backgrounds, so we need to figure out which one of those is being calculated.

      • calculateAmount

        public int calculateAmount(java.lang.String whatToCalc)
        This method is used to calculate how many of the Backgrounds/Obstacles the player has seen. Using a for-loop and integer. This number is used in Goal screen.
        Parameters:
        whatToCalc - This method can be used to calculate both Obstacles and Backgrounds, so we need to figure out which one of those is being calculated.
        Returns:
        The amount of true booleans in the array

      • getAmountOfEste

        public int getAmountOfEste()
        Returns:
        The amount of Obstacles there are in total

      • getAmountOfBack

        public int getAmountOfBack()
        Returns:
        The amount of Backgrounds there are in total
